item.title: I need help with the ladders in fally general store
item.dc:creator: @AustenGreen AustenGreen
item.description:
@AustenGreen wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:538142”]I don’t think the top of ladders have the same ID as the bottom parts.
Last I checked they were different. So I’m pretty sure you’re using the wrong ID.
Unless it’s a building with more than 2 floors and it has the same ladder model used twice in a row, but I could be wrong.
Also, what exactly is wrong? You didn’t really explain that.

You gave us code, said there’s a problem, but not what.
I believe there is a getHeight() you can use in PI, but I’m not 100% sure.[/quote]

Yeah the building has three floors

item.title: I need help with the ladders in fally general store
item.dc:creator: @AustenGreen AustenGreen
item.description:
@AustenGreen wrote:

This is for the falador ladders in general store
I am to the point where I need help I cannot figure out the rest.

This is what I have:

[code] case 11741:
if (obX == 2954 && obY == 3389) {
c.getPA().object(3562, 3389, 11741, 0, 1);
c.getPA().movePlayer(2954, 3388, 2);
} else if (obX == 2954 && obY == 3390) {
c.getPA().object(2954, 3390, 11741, -1, 0);
c.getPA().movePlayer(2955, 3390, 1);
} else if (obX == 2954 && obY == 3389 && c.heightLevel == 1) {
c.getPA().object(2954, 3389, 11741, 0, -1);
c.getPA().movePlayer(2954, 3390, 0);
} else if (obX == 2954 && obY == 3390) {
c.getPA().object(3558, 3390, 11741, 0, -1);
c.getPA().movePlayer(2954, 3390, 0);
}

        break;[/code]

The problematic one is the one that i added “&& c.heightLevel == 1” to the code.

I was wondering if you could do somthing like this: c.heightLevel == 1
But the aforementioned does not work, so is there some way that i can still do c.heightLevel == 1?
because it would be the most accurate way to do it that i can think of.

Thanks, Austen

Read full topic
item.source: I need help with the ladders in fally general store
